page.title: 01HOUSING IN S / E DUNSTABLE
page.content: In South East Dunstable the housing can be divided into two groups.The older is found along the Luton Road and consists of "between_wars"ribbon developments of semi_detatched and terraced houses,with occasional bungalows between.The newer houses were built post World War II about 1950_1960 and"in_filled the areas between Luton Road and Blows Downs.This newer housing consists of semi_detatched houses and bungalows with a few flats and maisonettes.Nowadays nearly all houses have inside bathrooms and toilets with piped water (both hot & cold)and are connected to mains drainage.All are supplied with either gas or electricity and many have both.
